definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.chinese: 是的，我有一點點的神經質。

sentences.english: His mouth continued to twitch unspeaking in nervous curls of disdain.
sentences.chinese: 嘴脣卻一個勁兒地抽搐着，顯示出神經質的嘲諷。

sentences.english: And then she did it up again nervously and quickly.
sentences.chinese: 她又神經質地很快地把頭髮梳起來。

sentences.english: Sweets tittered. It was a ghastly sound.
sentences.chinese: 糖果發出一聲恐怖的神經質的笑聲。

sentences.english: But this herbal Viagra isn't for those of nervous disposition.
sentences.chinese: 但是這種草本偉哥不適用於神經質人羣。

sentences.english: Nervousness or exuberant outbursts of emotion are not usually associated with Virgos.
sentences.chinese: 神經質或者是激情澎湃很難與處女座掛上鉤。

sentences.english: The personality characteristic of menopausal women represents the higher neuroticism and psychoticism.
sentences.chinese: 更年期婦女的人格特徵表現爲較高的神經質和精神質。

sentences.english: He wants to divorce her because she is so neurotic.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她太神經質了，所以他要跟她離婚。

sentences.english: The abnormality of menstrual volume was positively related with neuroticism .
sentences.chinese: 經量不規律與神經質呈正相關。

sentences.english: The jumpy mother is always cross with her children.
sentences.chinese: 這個神經質的母親老是對孩子發脾氣。

sentences.english: Since his last failure, my brother has been a nervous wreck every time before the finals.
sentences.chinese: 自從上次考砸後，我弟弟每次期末考試前都很神經質。

sentences.english: I think his normalness is the most psychotic thing.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他的正常就是他最神經質的事。

sentences.english: "He is a nervous, bilious subject, " said Larrey;
sentences.chinese: “這是個神經質的，易動肝火的人，”拉雷說。
不要和神經質的人結婚。

sentences.english: I think that I'm neurotically very, very sensitive to wanting to be as much a real person as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我近乎神經質地渴望儘可能地做一個真實的人。

sentences.english: She giggled nervously when the judges congratulated her on her costume.
sentences.chinese: 評判員讚賞她的服裝，她神經質地笑了起來。

definition: incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
